comments:
Build ID: I20061214-1445

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Call ResourcesPlugin.getWorkspace().getNatureDescriptors() to get a list of all available natures
2. Add all nature IDs to the project description list of nature IDs
3. Get the following exception in the .metadata/.log file:

!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 1 2 2007-04-09 10:25:34.577
!MESSAGE Project nature org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.ModuleCoreNature does not implement IProjectNature.
!STACK 0
java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.ComponentCore
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.NatureManager.createNature(NatureManager.java:231)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.NatureManager$1.run(NatureManager.java:142)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.NatureManager.configureNature(NatureManager.java:158)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.NatureManager.configureNatures(NatureManager.java:203)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.basicSetDescription(Project.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.setDescription(Project.java:978)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.setDescription(Project.java:1006)


More information:
In fact it does implement this interface, is it possible you have some workspace/classpath issues?
